results.title: Close-up on Kuwait
results.creator_credit: Rodney Giesler, Derek Armstrong and Kuwait Oil Company Film Unit
results.brief_description: From Kuwait more oil is shipped annually than from any other oil port in the world, bringing in return a wealth of manufactured goods from other countries. A Government Development Board ensures that the country as a whole shares this new prosperity in the free State medical service, schools, and research into cultivation of desert areas.

results.title: Clockwork lemon
results.creator_credit: Michael Rubetzki, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Working series”.
One of a series of films about attitudes to work. Shows the effects of technological change on the worker in the printing industry. Do computers take away the enjoyment of the job? Have a lot of skills been lost? Is job security at risk?

results.title: Climb
results.creator_credit: Dewitt Jones, Churchill Films and Film Technology Company
results.brief_description: This is both a realistic adventure of rock-climbing and a metaphorical ascent in which limits are tested and personal values are explored. As the two climbers express their thoughts in the narration, we watch their breathtaking progress up a sheer rock face in Yosemite Valley. We learn a few rudiments of rock-climbing and about the climbers feelings and motivations.

results.title: The Climates of North America
results.creator_credit: Joseph Koenig, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The film shows what climate is and how it shapes the vegetation and the life of the inhabitants of North America’s climatic regions - from the North Pole to the Tropic of Cancer.

results.title: Cliff hangers [B&W]
results.creator_credit: Donald Mulholland and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Over a gleaming ice field and up steep cliffs of bare rock, the camera follows members of the Alpine Club of Canada. Before they set out we are introduced to the climbers’ basic equipment and learn the uses of rope and ice axe. Excitement mounts with the Alpinists as they leap gaping chasms and drag themselves up a sheer wall of rock. At the top, they pause for a view of the sea of mountains lying around their own vanquished peak. Narrated by Lorne Greene.

results.title: Clement Meadmore
results.brief_description: A modern sculptor in steel. This film is a plea for a sensible approach to modern art. It opens with Clement Meadmore welding a sculpture in his backyard in Sydney, followed by a survey of his works. Meadmore, who is also a leading designer in the field of fabrics and textiles, works with austere and means creating sculptures of purity of form and clarity of expression. Filmed, written and edited by Bruce Beresford. Narrated by John Bell.

results.title: Clearing the way
results.brief_description: A certain vacant allotment in Manhattan, New York, was regarded by a group of children as their own particular stamping-ground. Came the day when the building of the United Nations Organisation headquarters began on that allotment. The children, deprived of their playground, set out to find just what sort of an organisation United Nations Organisation was, and what sort of work it does.

results.title: Clear across Australia
results.brief_description: Illustrates the advances being made in telecommunications in Australia. A microwave radio repeater system now joins the systems of Eastern and Western Australia. Shows the phases of construction and the benefits of this system which is vital to our communications network.

results.title: Cleanliness and health
results.brief_description: Micro-photography is used to show the existence of micro-organisms and how these may be controlled. The film explains how these organisms are responsible for disease and how to avoid such diseases. Careful attention must be paid to the rules of cleanliness.
